intro: Barleria grandipetala, commonly known as the large-petaled barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive blue-gray color. Its showy, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central spur. Barleria grandipetala thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
